questions.text: What are the three main principles of drill?
questions.explanation: The three main principles of drill are Smartness (furti), Steadiness (sthirta), and Coordination (milkar kaam karna).

questions.text: What is the standard step length for 'Tez Chal'?
questions.explanation: The standard step length for 'Tez Chal' is 30 inches with a pace of 116 steps per minute for NCC cadets.

questions.text: Which part of the body should move first when turning right?
questions.explanation: When turning right, the movement starts with the right foot heel and left foot toe pivoting to achieve the turn.

questions.text: What is the purpose of 'Kadwar Sizing' in drill?

options.a: To arrange cadets by height for better appearance

questions.explanation: Kadwar Sizing arranges cadets by height with tallest on the right and shortest on the left for better visual appearance in ceremonial drill.

questions.text: In which position are the heels together and toes at 30 degrees?
questions.explanation: In Savdhan position, heels are together and toes form a 30-degree angle with feet straight and knees braced back.

questions.text: What is the correct hand position for 'Vishram'?

options.a: Both hands behind back, left over right
options.b: Both hands behind back, right over left

questions.explanation: In Vishram position, both hands are behind the back with right hand over left hand, thumbs interlocked and fingers straight.

questions.text: How many parts does a word of command have?
questions.explanation: A word of command has two parts - Cautionary (prepares for action) and Executive (executes the action), with four quick steps between them.

questions.text: What is the pace rate for 'Dhire Chal'?
questions.explanation: 'Dhire Chal' is performed at 70 steps per minute with a step length of 30 inches, used during VIP inspections.

questions.text: Which drill movement is used to change direction by 180 degrees?
questions.explanation: 'Piche Mud' is used to change direction by 180 degrees while maintaining the formation.

questions.text: What is 'Khuli Line Chal' used for?
questions.explanation: 'Khuli Line Chal' is used for weapon inspection and VIP review where cadets need to be spaced out for better visibility.

questions.text: In rifle drill, what is 'Bagal Shastra' position used for?
questions.explanation: 'Bagal Shastra' is used for marching with rifle and during march past in ceremonial parades.

questions.text: What is the correct angle for the rifle in 'Salami Shastra'?
questions.explanation: In 'Salami Shastra', the rifle is held at 90 degrees to the body as the highest form of rifle salute.

questions.text: Which of these is considered a bad habit in drill?
questions.explanation: Rolling eyes is considered a bad habit in drill along with hopping, dragging feet, clicking heels, and moving fingers.

questions.text: What is the purpose of 'Tez Kadam Taal'?
questions.explanation: 'Tez Kadam Taal' is used for correcting alignment, dressing, and spacing between cadets in formation.

questions.text: In Guard Mounting, who receives the report from the Guard Commander?
questions.explanation: The Orderly Officer receives the report 'Guard nirikshan ke lie hazir hai' from the Guard Commander during Guard Mounting ceremony.

questions.text: What is the standard distance between cadets in open formation?
questions.explanation: The standard distance between cadets in open formation is 36 inches from center to center.

questions.text: Which command is used to dismiss a parade temporarily?
questions.explanation: 'Line Tod' is used to dismiss a parade temporarily when they need to fall in again later, without formal dismissal.

questions.text: What is the correct position of thumbs in Savdhan?
questions.explanation: In Savdhan position, thumbs are straight and placed along the seam of the trousers with fingers naturally curled.

questions.text: Which foot steps off first when marching?
questions.explanation: The left foot always steps off first when marching forward from stationary position.

questions.text: What is 'Nikat Line Chal' used for?
questions.explanation: 'Nikat Line Chal' is used to close the formation after inspection when cadets need to come closer together.

questions.text: In rifle drill, what is the purpose of 'Bhumi Shastra'?
questions.explanation: 'Bhumi Shastra' is the command to ground arms or place the rifle on the ground from Savdhan position.

questions.text: How many cadets form a standard Guard of Honour for the President?
questions.explanation: A Guard of Honour for the President consists of 150 rank and file personnel formed in three divisions.

questions.text: What is the correct response after receiving a word of command?
questions.explanation: After receiving the executive part of a word of command, it should be executed immediately without hesitation.

questions.text: Which position allows relaxation while maintaining basic posture?
questions.explanation: 'Aram Se' allows relaxation of the upper body while maintaining foot position and basic posture.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of drill in military training?
questions.explanation: The primary purpose of drill is to instill discipline, teamwork, obedience to commands, and collective working spirit.

questions.text: In which year was drill first introduced in armies according to NCC curriculum?
questions.explanation: Drill was first introduced in armies by Major General Dral of Germany in 1666 to maintain control and discipline.

questions.text: What is the correct eye position during drill?
questions.explanation: During drill, eyes should look straight ahead with chin up, maintaining an alert and forward-looking posture.

questions.text: Which command is used to form three files from single file?
questions.explanation: 'Teenon Teen Ban' is the command to form three files from single file formation.

questions.text: What is the distance between ranks in close order drill?
questions.explanation: In close order drill, the distance between ranks is 40 inches from back to chest.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a type of drill?
questions.explanation: The two main types of drill are Open Drill (field) and Close Drill (parade ground). Combat Drill is not classified separately.

questions.text: What is 'Parade Par' command used for?
questions.explanation: 'Parade Par' is used to start the parade and bring troops to the parade ground in an organized manner.

questions.text: In rifle salute, which part should be at eye level?
questions.explanation: During rifle salute, the fore sight should be at eye level, about 1 inch above the right eyebrow.

questions.text: What is the correct way to hold rifle in 'Baju Shastra'?
questions.explanation: In 'Baju Shastra', the left hand holds the barrel near flash hider in U-shape while right hand holds the hand guard.

questions.text: Which VIP receives a National Salute?
questions.explanation: Only the President and State Governors (within their states) receive the National Salute.

questions.text: What is the purpose of 'Dahine/Baen Dekh'?
questions.explanation: 'Dahine/Baen Dekh' is used to acknowledge a salute while marching past a saluting base.

questions.text: In Guard Mounting, who inspects the rifle?
questions.explanation: The Orderly Officer inspects each rifle during 'Nirikshan ke liye Janch Shastra' in Guard Mounting ceremony.

questions.text: What is the correct position for 'Samne Salute'?
questions.explanation: In 'Samne Salute', the palm faces down with fingers straight and together, thumb along index finger.

questions.text: Which command is given to correct step timing?
questions.explanation: 'Kadam Badal' is used to correct step timing when a cadet's step is out of synchronization with others.

questions.text: What is the distance for side step?
questions.explanation: Side steps (Dahine/Baen Baju Kadam) are 12 inches to the side to adjust alignment.

questions.text: In ceremonial drill, where does the Guard Commander position himself?
questions.explanation: The Guard Commander positions himself on the right of the guard formation during ceremonial drill.

questions.text: What is 'Uthao Shastra'?
questions.explanation: 'Uthao Shastra' means 'take up arms' - to pick up the rifle from the ground to Savdhan position.

questions.text: How many steps are taken before turning during march?
questions.explanation: Generally, three steps are taken to complete a turn while marching to maintain balance and coordination.

questions.text: What is the primary quality of a good word of command?
questions.explanation: A good word of command should have appropriate loudness and perfect clarity to be understood immediately.

questions.text: Which foot is used for the halt?
questions.explanation: The halt is executed on the next foot that touches the ground after the command 'Tham' is given.

questions.text: What is the purpose of instructional practice in drill?
questions.explanation: Instructional practice is used to train new instructors in proper command voice and drill teaching methods.

questions.text: In which position are hands clenched behind back?
questions.explanation: In Vishram position, hands are clenched behind the back with right hand over left.

questions.text: What is the correct response to 'Visarjan'?
questions.explanation: On 'Visarjan', cadets turn right, salute, take three steps forward and march off formally.

questions.text: Which of these is a ceremonial drill?
questions.explanation: Guard Mounting is a ceremonial drill, while others are training activities.

questions.text: What is the correct angle for 'Adha Dahine/Baen Mud'?
questions.explanation: 'Adha Dahine/Baen Mud' is a 45-degree turn, half of the standard 90-degree turn.

questions.text: What is the ultimate test of good drill?
questions.explanation: The ultimate test of good drill is perfectly coordinated movement where the entire squad moves as one unit.
